attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: (20x) Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Energy Restore
text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, put a basic Energy card from your discard pile into your hand. If you don't have that many basic Energy cards in your discard pile, put all of them into your hand.

cards.name: Master Ball
text: Look at 7 cards from the top of your deck. You may choose a Basic Pokémon or Evolution card from those cards, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle the rest into your deck.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

ability.name: Miraculous Powder
ability.text: Once during your turn (before you attack), you may remove all Special Conditions from your Active Pokémon. This power can't be used if Butterfree is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, remove 2 damage counters from Butterfree.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during you opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Supersonic Flight
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

ability.name: Chaos Move
ability.text: Once during your turn (before you attack), if your opponent has 3 or fewer Prizes, you may move 1 damage counter from 1 Pokémon (yours or your opponent's) to another (even if it would Knock Out the other Pokémon). This power can't be used if Gengar is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Hide in Shadows
attacks.text: Switch Gengar with one of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Overrun
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of them and this attack does 10 damage to it. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

ability.name: Energy Connect
ability.text: Once during your turn (before you attack), you make take one basic Energy cards attached to one of your Benched Pokémon and attach it to your Active Pokémon. This power can't be used if Ampharos is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Lightning Strike
attacks.text: You may discard all Energy cards attached to Ampharos. If you do, this attack's base damage is 80 instead of 40.

attacks.name: Tail Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to Charizard.

attacks.name: Magnitude
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Poison Seed
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

ability.name: Terraforming
ability.text: Once during your turn (before you attack), you may look at the top 4 cards of your deck and rearrange them as you like. This power can't be used if Machamp is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Iron Fist
attacks.text: (50+) Count the number of Pokémon you have in play with damage counters on them. Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each of those Pokémon.

ability.name: Soothing Aroma
ability.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon that has any. This power can't be used if Meganium is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Poisonpowder
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Super Psywave
attacks.text: Choose one of you opponent's Pokémon. Count the number of Energy cards attached to that Pokémon. Put that many damage counters on the Pokémon.

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.text: If there are any Energy cards in your discard pile, flip a coin. If heads, attach one of them to Raichu.

attacks.name: Shock Bolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Raichu or this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: If this attack damages the Defending Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance), remove 1 damage counter from Venusaur, is it has any.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: (30x) Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

ability.name: Poison Pollen
ability.text: Once during your turn (before you attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. This power can't be used if Vileplume is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Petal Dance
attacks.text: (30x) Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads. Vileplume is now Confused.

attacks.name: Foul Gas
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Misfire
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, put 6 damage counters on Weezing.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: Croconaw does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, Flaaffy does 20 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Flaming Punch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Thrash
attacks.text: (30+) Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 damage plus 10 more damage. If tails, Magmar does 10 damage to itself.

attacks.name: Shining Fingers
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Bone Smash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: (10+) Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

cards.name: Pokemon Reversal
text: Choose one of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. Flip a coin. If heads, switch that Pokémon with the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Darkness Energy (Special)
text: If the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to does damage with an attack (after applying Weakness and Resistance), the attack does 10 more damage. At the end of every turn, put 1 damage counter on the Pokémon Darkness Energy is attached to, unless it's D or has Dark in its name. Darkness Energy provides D Energy. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card.)

cards.name: Full Heal
text: Remove all Special Conditions from your Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Power Charge
text: Flip a coin. If heads, shuffle 2 Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck (1 if you have only 1).

cards.name: Strength Charm
text: Whenever an attack from the Pokémon that Strength Charm is attached to does damage (after applying Weakness and Resistance), the attack does 10 more damage. At the end of the turn in which this happens, discard Strength Charm.

cards.name: Professor Elm's Training Method
text: Search your deck for an Evolution card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Professor Oak's Research
text: Shuffle your hand into your deck, then draw 5 cards.

cards.name: Super Scoop Up
text: Flip a coin. If heads, return 1 of your Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

cards.name: Warp Point
text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any; then you switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon, if any.

cards.name: Energy Search
text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Moo-Moo Milk
text: Choose 1 of your Pokémon. Flip 2 coins. Remove 2 damage counters times the number of heads from that Pokémon. If the Pokémon has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

cards.name: Potion
text: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon (1 if it has only 1).

cards.name: Mary's Impulse
text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, draw 2 cards.

ability.name: Psymimic
ability.text: Once during your turn, instead of Alakazam's normal attack, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon's attack. Alakazam copies that attack including its Energy costs and anything else required in order to use that attack, such as discarding Energy cards. (No matter what type that Pokémon is, Alakazam's type is still Psychic.) This power can't be used if Alakazam is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Syncroblast
attacks.text: If Alakazam and the Defending Pokémon don't have the same number of Energy cards on them, this attack's base damage is 20 instead of 80.
